topic.title: Layer-2 and Layer-3 Switching
topic.shortdesc: The layer-2 and layer-3 boundaries are separated at the aggregation layer.

body.p: The Reference Architecture uses layer-2 as the reference up to the aggregation layer. That is why VLT is used on the aggregation switches. Red Hat Foreman OpenStack Manager requires a layer-2 domain in order to provision servers.

The three optional links (Provisioning, Storage, and Management) represent uplinks to a gateway device. The Provisioning network can use the Red Hat Foreman OpenStack Manager as a proxy for pulling packages from a subscription server, or a gateway can be added. The EqualLogic arrays on the Storage network may need access:

ul.li: To be used by EqualLogic Host Integration toolset

body.p: There are many tools for OOB management for the iDRAC, by simply adding the gateway to the network and updating the iDRAC these tools can be used.
